page.title: 08FELMINGHAM PARISH COUNCIL
page.content: The members of the Parish Council are elected by parishioners to administer the Parish of Felmingham. It's main functions are: {1}to comment on planning applications, {2}to let the allotments in the parish, {3}to inform District & County Councils about problems of health,transport etc {4}to manage BryantS heath, about 40 acres of common land {5}to represent the Parish on School Boards and other Trusts {6}to manage the Village sign & bus shelter {7}to precept the Parish Rate {8}to liase with Public bodies looking after the elderly, young, poor & infirm, & the Local Constabulary {9}to campaign for a fair share of public services, ie water, sewerage, waste disposal and transport.
